clinical_study.brief_title: Absorption and Safety With Sustained Use of RELiZORB Evaluation (ASSURE) Study
clinical_study.official_title: Absorption and Safety With Sustained Use of RELiZORB Evaluation (ASSURE) Study in Patients With Cystic Fibrosis Receiving Enteral Feeding

brief_summary.textblock: Protocol 0000498: Multicenter, open label study to evaluate the effect of sustained RELiZORB (immobilized lipase) cartridge use during enteral feeding on fat absorption, as well as safety and tolerability of sustained RELiZORB use, in patients with cystic fibrosis and exocrine pancreatic insufficiency.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study Entry (Day -14): Baseline blood samples collected for plasma and erythrocyte concentrations of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) and eicosapentaenoic (EPA). Baseline characteristics collected included BMI and cystic fibrosis related diabetes.
Observation Period (Day -14 to Day -8): Subjects followed their usual enteral nutrition regimen with pancreatic enzyme replacement therapy (PERT).
Run-in Period (Day -7 to Day -1): Subjects used Peptamen 1.5 enteral formula at their normal volume of administration from 500 mL to 1,000 mL per feeding with usual PERT regimen.
Treatment Period (Day 0 to Day 90): Subjects used Impact Peptide 1.5 up to a maximum volume of 1,000 mL per feeding with RELiZORB for the 90 day treatment period. Blood screening measurements were repeated at start of treatment period (Day 0), Day 30, Day 60 and Day 90. PERT use with enteral feedings was prohibited. Safety and tolerability were assessed with GI symptom diaries and systematic assessments of adverse events and unanticipated adverse device effects.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Erythrocyte Omega-3 Index % (DHA+EPA)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Day 0 to Day 90 of erythrocyte tissue composition % of the omega-3 index

secondary_outcome.time_frame: RELiZORB Treatment Period (Day 0-Day 90): 90 days with additional 30 days of follow up.
secondary_outcome.description: A UADE is analogous to a serious adverse event (SAE), defined as an AE, occurring at any exposure to the therapeutic agent, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, life-threatening AE, inpatient hospitalization or prolonged existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity or a congenital anomaly/birth defect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Plasma Concentration Total DHA+EPA
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in plasma concentration total DHA+EPA from baseline (Day 0 to Day 90).
Changes over time in erythrocyte composition (%) for total DHA in ITT population (n=39)
Changes over time in erythrocyte composition (%) for EPA in ITT population

secondary_outcome.measure: Erythrocyte Composition (%) Ratio of n6/n3 Fatty Acids
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to Day 90 in n6/n3 ratio in erythrocytes

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Composition (%) Ratio of n6/n3 Fatty Acids.
secondary_outcome.description: Change over time in n6/n3 ratio in plasma in the ITT population

other_outcome.time_frame: Observation, Baseline and RELiZORB Treatment periods (Day -14 to Day 90): 104 days with additional 30 days of follow up.
other_outcome.description: GI symptoms recorded in GI diaries by subject and/or caregiver.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Single Arm: Open label RELiZORB Cartridge & Impact Peptide 1.5
arm_group.description: RELiZORB (immobilized lipase) cartridge and Impact Peptide 1.5 with enteral feedings ranging from 500 mL to 1,000 mL per feeding for a period of 90 days.

intervention.description: Hydrolyzing fats from enteral formula, ex vivo, with in-line enteral feed RELiZORB (immobilized lipase) cartridge
intervention.arm_group_label: Single Arm: Open label RELiZORB Cartridge & Impact Peptide 1.5

intervention.description: Impact Peptide 1.5 at a volume of administration from 500 mL to 1,000 mL per enteral feeding
intervention.arm_group_label: Single Arm: Open label RELiZORB Cartridge & Impact Peptide 1.5

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Confirmed diagnosis of cystic fibrosis
2. Documented history of exocrine pancreatic insufficiency
3. Enteral formula use a minimum of 4x/week, using PERT, consuming an unrestricted fat diet, and willing to use Peptamen 1.5 and Impact Peptide 1.5
4. Written informed consent or assent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
2. Signs and symptoms of liver cirrhosis or portal hypertension
3. Lung or liver transplant
4. Active cancer currently receiving cancer treatment
5. Crohn's or celiac disease, infectious gastroenteritis, sprue, lactose intolerance, inflammatory bowel disease

clinical_study.keyword: CF, EPI, diabetes, PERT, LCPUFA, DHA, EPA, Omega-3 index

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was conducted through Cystic Fibrosis Care Centers.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 7-day Observation Period: Maintain usual enteral feeding (EF) regimen. 7-day Run-in period: Maintain usual EF volume up to a max of 1000 mL using standard formula for at least 5 days. 49 subjects signed consent; 5 screen failed; 44 started the observation period; 39 completed observation and run-in periods entering the treatment period.

group.title: Single Arm: Open Label
group.description: 49 subjects signed consent and were screened for the study. 44 subjects were eligible at time of screening. 39 subjects entered the treatment period.

group.title: Single Arm: Open Label
group.description: RELiZORB cartridge and Impact Peptide 1.5 with enteral feeding 500 mL to 1,000 mL per enteral feeding for a period of 90 days. RELiZORB: Novel enteral feeding in-line digestive enzyme cartridge Impact Peptide 1.5: Impact Peptide 1.5 at a volume of administration from 500 mL to 1,000 mL per enteral feeding

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Erythrocyte omega-3 index %
measure.population: ITT was 39, missing sample data due to one subject discontinuing prior Visit 3 therefore analysis population: N=38 Erythrocyte omega-3 index % measures erythrocyte membrane composition (%) of DHA+EPA.
measure.units: % of omega-3 index of RBC membrane

outcome.title: Change From Baseline of Erythrocyte Omega-3 Index % (DHA+EPA)
outcome.description: Change from baseline Day 0 to Day 90 of erythrocyte tissue composition % of the omega-3 index
outcome.population: Intent to treat population = 39 subjects who received at least one exposure to RELiZORB. Analysis group is 38 due to one subject discontinuing prior to Visit 3.

group.title: RELiZORB Cartridge With Standard Enteral Formula
group.description: Patients with exocrine pancreatic insufficiency, age 5 and older, all sexes who have an enteral feeding a minimum of 4 times per week.

measure.title: Change From Baseline of Erythrocyte Omega-3 Index % (DHA+EPA)
measure.description: Change from baseline Day 0 to Day 90 of erythrocyte tissue composition % of the omega-3 index
measure.population: Intent to treat population = 39 subjects who received at least one exposure to RELiZORB. Analysis group is 38 due to one subject discontinuing prior to Visit 3.

outcome.title: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effects (UADE)
outcome.description: A UADE is analogous to a serious adverse event (SAE), defined as an AE, occurring at any exposure to the therapeutic agent, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, life-threatening AE, inpatient hospitalization or prolonged existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity or a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: RELiZORB Treatment Period (Day 0-Day 90): 90 days with additional 30 days of follow up.

group.title: RELiZORB Treatment Period (Day 0 - Day 90)
group.description: All subjects who entered the RELiZORB Treatment period and received at least one treatment with the study device. 39 subjects entered treatment period of EF with RELiZORB.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data collected and reported for 14 days during the Observation and Run-in periods. Adverse event data collected and reported for 120 days for the RELiZORB period.
reported_events.desc: Adverse event data were collected from study entry at day -14 to end of study (Day -14 through 90). Follow up of events present at end of study/termination continued for an additional 30 days after completion of study.

group.title: Observation and Run-in Period (Day -14 to Day -1)
group.description: This 14 day period was comprised of 7 day Observation period followed by 7 day Run-in period. 44 subjects were enrolled of which 39 proceeded to treatment period of EF with RELiZORB.

group.title: RELiZORB Treatment Period (Day 0 - Day 90)
group.description: Safety population is defined as all subjects who entered the RELiZORB Treatment period and received at least one treatment with the study device. 39 subjects entered treatment period of EF with RELiZORB.

event.sub_title: Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication by the PI of any data from this study is strictly prohibited without consent from the sponsor.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Patient GI symptom diary: recall method using unvalidated tool. Patients were allowed to eat normal diet during the day, hence the amount of LCPUFA that was measured in the plasma is not the sole reflection of the device use only.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Madhumalli ("Molly") Sarkar, MD, PhD, Head of Clinical Development
